summary: Interactive romantic Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) for iPad Chrome: asks girlfriend to be Valentine with Yes/No buttons, evasive No hover behavior, and a Yes-click reveal with meme image and long personalized love message in a cartoonish romantic theme.
architectural_notes: Single static HTML page with embedded CSS/JS (no backend) to run locally on iPad Chrome.
Use client-side DOM events (hover/mousemove/touch) to reposition the 'No' button within viewport bounds.
Include an image asset (local file or URL) for the meme shown after clicking 'Yes'.
Ensure mobile/iPad compatibility (responsive layout; handle touch interactions).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style cartoon romantic illustration with a couple, hearts/sparkles, warm pink/red palette, playful vector-like outlines, and embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” (valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Add the meme-style image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx using the exact filename valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png (do not serve images through the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed interactive Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) runnable on iPad Chrome
Add Yes/No options where hovering over 'No' moves it away to prevent clicking
On 'Yes' click, display a meme image and show the personalized love message (cartoonish romantic styling)

Update the standalone page at frontend/public/valentine.html to be a simple, romantic-themed, single-purpose Valentine prompt that asks “Will you be my Valentine, my love?” with exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”, optimized for iPad Chrome.

Implement the evasive “No” behavior on the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html): when the user hovers over or touches the “No” button, it moves to a new random position within its container so it cannot be clicked, while ensuring it does not overlap the “Yes” button.

On “Yes” click, show a celebration/reveal view (in both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx) that displays: (1) the meme-style image with embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” and (2) the full love letter message content provided by the user, formatted as readable paragraphs in a scrollable layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic visual theme across both the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html) and the React flow (frontend/src/App.tsx): warm pink/red palette, playful rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, and a friendly cartoon-like typographic feel, while keeping the UI simple and focused on the single Valentine question and reveal.

projectName: Cartoonish romantic Valentine page with evasive “No” and “Yes” reveal (meme + love letter)
